qas.question: Which year was there not a Summer Olympic Game?
In what year was a women's tournament added to the Summer Olympics?
What year were professional players allowed to play in the  Summer Olympics?
What is the age limit on the Olympic men's tournament?
What was the first year that there was a football tournament at the Summer Olympics?
Which year was there not a Winter Olympic Game?
What year was a men's tournament added to the Summer Olympics?
What year were novice players allowed to play in the Summer Olympics?
What is the age requirement on the Olympic men's tournament?
What was the last year that there was a football tournament at the Winter Olympics?

context: There has been a football tournament at every Summer Olympic Games since <a4_0><b9_0>1900<b9_0/><a4_0/>, except at the <a0_0><b5_0>1932<b5_0/><a0_0/> games in Los Angeles. Before the inception of the World Cup, the Olympics (especially during the 1920s) had the same status as the World Cup. Originally, the event was for amateurs only; however, since the <a2_0><b7_0>1984<b7_0/><a2_0/> Summer Olympics, professional players have been permitted, albeit with certain restrictions which prevent countries from fielding their strongest sides. The Olympic men's tournament is played at <a3_0>Under-<b8_0>23<b8_0/><a3_0/> level. In the past the Olympics have allowed a restricted number of over-age players per team. A women's tournament was added in <a1_0><b6_0>1996<b6_0/><a1_0/>; in contrast to the men's event, full international sides without age restrictions play the women's Olympic tournament.
